intro: Ageratina flourensifolia, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that are often arranged in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina flourensifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
